page.title: 02COMMUNITY POLICING,S.LEEDS.
page.content: P.C.Cryer has been our community constable in Beeston for three and a half years but has been a policeman for six years.His job is to get to know the local people and to protect the local community. His job is not only to enforce the law in our area,he also helps to sort out domestic arguments,helps children to cross the roads,directs the traffic and deals with crowd control at Elland Road Football Stadium. The only protection he has is a truncheon and his helmet.He has never been trained to use a gun and says he never wants to have to use a gun for his job.He says the worst part of his job is when he has to deal with death and the best part is meeting people and being invited into schools to talk to young people.
